title: White House will allow some U.S. companies to sell to Huawei
text:
President Donald Trump has reportedly agreed to give out licences for the sale of some components the U.S. government does not consider to have security implications. The administration issued orders that effectively banned sales to Huawei in May, but the rules have yet to take effect. (New York Times)

Talking point: The reports come as amid formal trade talks began Thursday between U.S. and Chinese officials, the first since July. Beijing has prioritized the lifting of sanctions on Chinese tech firms, and on Thursday a foreign ministry spokesperson called for the U.S. to back off Huawei specifically. The licences would remove at least one barrier to an agreement, but it’s far from the only one. On Wednesday, for example, Washington imposed visa restrictions on Chinese officials linked to human rights abuses in China’s Xinjiang province.
